cards.title: Degree
cards.description: I am finishing my Bachelor's Degree in Software Engineering at McGill University. I have 5 classes remaining in my degree which I expect to finish by December 2014.

cards.title: C
cards.description: I have developed a simple file system in C (SimpleFS). Although the system is not yet production ready, the accompanying document should help you understand how it works.

cards.title: C++
cards.description: I have not had a lot of experience with C++, but I am not afraid to learn. After playing a bit with MIPS, I must admit the prospect of learning a new programming language tickles my fancy.

cards.title: OSS
cards.description: I have never bought a single software in my life: The Open Source Mentality might be one of my strongest traits as of today (after being awesome obviously).

cards.title: TCP/IP
cards.description: Last semester, a close friend and I started to perform an in-depth study on the AirPlay Protocol. You can also check out the presentation.

cards.title: OOP
cards.description: Even if it is not my favourite language, I must admit Java is one of my strong suits. My team and I got the highest number of goals with our StormChaser back in 2012.

cards.title: Networking
cards.description: Assuming you are talking about Computer Networking ;). I have extensively used tools such as Bactrack, its successor, Kali, and used my home server for a year as an exit node on the Tor Network.

cards.title: Cross-Platform
cards.description: I tried my first linux distro (Mandriva) in 2004, and quickly gave up on Windows back in 2008. I switched distros multiple times - going from Mint, Ubuntu, elementaryOS and Puppy - to end up on Fedora, on which I have been for the past 4 years.

cards.title: Version Control
cards.description: I only swear by git. I have tried others such as SVN and Mercurial, but the hype around GitHub made me throw everything on git. No regrets fosho.

cards.title: Documentation
cards.description: For what concerns documentation, I cultivate a strong hatred for github repositories without README...
